title: Israel used US - made bomb in deadly Rafah strike , experts say
message:
MUST CREDIT: Alam Sadeq (Alam Sadeq)Four weapons experts said the Israeli military used a U.S.-made precision bomb in a strike that killed at least 45 people in southern Gaza on Sunday, after reviewing visual evidence provided to The Washington Post.
The findings do not contradict Israel’s assertion that it used a small munition, weapons experts said.
Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Wednesday that the United States couldn’t confirm what weapons were used or how they were used in the strike.
Israel said the attack on the encampment in Rafah was a "targeted" strike against two Hamas militants and employed "the smallest munition" Israeli fighter jets can use.
An Israeli military spokesman reached Wednesday said he could not comment further on the munition used or what measures were taken to prevent civilian casualties.
event_breakdown: The Israeli military used a U.S.-made precision bomb to kill at least 45 people in southern Gaza on Sunday, after reviewing visual evidence provided to The Washington Post.

title: Woman pleads guilty to stabbing , killing cousin in 2021 in York County
message:
Woman pleads guilty to stabbing, killing cousin in 2021 in York CountyYORK COUNTY, Pa. (WHTM) — A woman accused of stabbing and killing a relative in York County years ago pleaded guilty Tuesday.
Ninoska Santos-Cruz, 25, of York, entered an open plea to third-degree murder for the deadly stabbing on Dec. 26, 2021, the York County District Attorney’s Office confirmed.
York County babysitter claimed girl ‘seduced me’ during rape investigation, police sayJoselito Pagan-Ocasio, 36, was found dead at his home at the 300 block of E. King Street in York City.
First responders were dispatched for a fatality that was originally reported from a shooting but turned out to be from a stabbing.
An autopsy found Pagan-Ocasio died from a stab wound to the chest and the manner was ruled a homicide.
event_breakdown: Ninoska Santos-Cruz, 25, of York, entered an open plea to third-degree murder for the deadly stabbing on Dec. 26, 2021, the York County District Attorney’s Office confirmed. The crime scene is located at the 300 block of E. King Street in York City.

Chicago police say a man was shot by officers Monday night in the 300-block of South Cicero Avenue in South Austin. According to a news release, an officer in an unmarked police car tried to pull over a Ford car for a traffic violation around 11:10 p.m. The other driver then began firing shots at the officers, police said. The officers returned fire, striking the man and driving him to a hospital where he was pronounced dead at around 11:50 p.m., the release stated.

title: Street battles , Israeli strikes rock Gaza Rafah
message:
Street battles, Israeli strikes rock Gaza's RafahWorld World Street battles, Israeli strikes rock Gaza's RafahStreet fighting and Israeli bombardment rocked Gaza's far-southern Rafah on Wednesday.
But fighting again flared in Rafah, where an AFP reporter said street battles raged and an Israeli helicopter fired guns and missiles at targets in the city centre.
In the north, Israeli military vehicles unleashed intense gunfire east of Gaza City, an AFP reporter said, while residents reported air strikes on parts of Jabalia.
UN SECURITY COUNCILNearly eight months into the deadliest Gaza war, Israel has faced ever louder opposition, as well as cases before two Netherlands-based international courts.

event_breakdown:
Hamas-Israel fighting flares as Palestinian teen killed by Israeli gunfireClashes between Israeli forces and Palestinian militants have intensified in recent days culminating in the death of a 13-year-old Palestinian boy in the West Bank.
In retaliation for the boy's death, Hamas fired rockets into Israel, causing no damage.
But the escalations were far from over. Israel Defense Forces spokesperson Lieutenant Colonel Peter Lerner said the military had bombed a second target in the Gaza Strip.
"We have been attacked by rockets from Hamas. Our response is an attack on a second target in the Gaza Strip," Lerner said.
Israel first bombed a Hamas target inside the Gaza Strip. Then Israel Defense Forces (IDF) also targeted some Palestinian militants it said had been firing rockets into Israel. And the IDF warned Gaza militants not to retaliate for the attack.

title: Israel Launches Airstrikes Deep Into Syria - Reports Of Civilians Dead & Wounded
message:
Israel's military on Wednesday launched a fresh attack on targets deep inside Syria, which reportedly left civilian casualties, according to state media.
Syrian government sources said the Israeli strike killed a girl and wounded ten civilians.
"Syrian air defense intercepts enemy targets in the skies of the city of Homs," the official SANA news agency also reported.
Israel was also part of this covert campaign, which saw the anti-Assad axis arm, train, and fund various al-Qaeda and jihadist groups.
In the initial days and weeks after Oct.7, Syria had lobbed several rockets toward the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights, which left no casualties.
event_breakdown: Israel strikes Syria in response to rocket fire in the Golan Heights, reportedly killing a girl and wounding ten civilians.

message:

Kim has described spy satellites as crucial for monitoring U.S. and South Korean military activities and enhancing the threat posed by his nuclear-capable missiles.

title: Missile attacks damage a ship in the Red Sea off Yemen coast near previous Houthi rebel assaults - New Delhi Times - India Only International Newspaper
message:
Missile attacks twice damaged a Marshall Islands-flagged, Greek-owned ship Tuesday in the Red Sea off the coast of Yemen, with a private security firm saying radio traffic suggested the vessel took on water after being struck.
The vessel reported being headed to Fujairah in the United Arab Emirates.
Central Command separately said it destroyed five Houthi drones over the Red Sea amid the attacks.
Shipping through the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden has declined because of the threat.
In recent weeks, the tempo of Houthi attacks has dropped, though the rebels have claimed shooting down U.S. surveillance drones.

The spirit of the United Nations is dead in Gaza,” Erdogan told lawmakers from his AKP party.

title: Yemen Houthis shoot down MQ - 9 Reaper drone
message:
视频播放位置 下载安装Flash播放器Houthi group said it shot down an MQ-9 Reaper drone on Wednesday over Yemen's central Marib.
Yahya Sarea, the group's military spokesman, said in the statement broadcast by Houthi-run al-Masirah TV that "a locally made surface-to-air missile is used in the operation, and this is the sixth MQ-9 Reaper drone we shot down in six months."
He added that "we will continue to develop our military defense capabilities to counter the U.S.- British coalition aggression against our country."
"We will also continue to support the Palestine people against the Israeli aggression until the conflict and blockade stop," the spokesman stressed.
The Houthi television said it would broadcast a video showing the operation of shooting down this drone.
event_breakdown: Target event - Houthi group said they shot down an MQ-9 Reaper drone over Yemen's central Marib.

title: Man Pleads Guilty , Sentenced to 14 Years for DHS Hotel Stabbing
message:
A man pleaded guilty Wednesday to assault and burglary charges for his role in a stabbing at a Desert Hot Springs hotel and was immediately sentenced to 14 years in prison.
Anthony Rene Ayala, 30, pleaded guilty before Judge Jason Stone at the Larson Justice Center in Indio to assault causing great bodily injury and first-degree burglary, according to Riverside County District Attorney’s office spokesman John Hall.
Two other men charged in the case, 30-year-old Jose Luis Garcia and 32-year-old Moises Mazariegos, previously pleaded guilty to the same charges.
The stabbing occurred around 11 p.m. April 15, 2021, at a hotel in the 11000 block of Palm Drive, according to the Desert Hot Springs Police Department.
Ayala has two robbery convictions, Garcia has convictions for burglary and attempted robbery, and Reynaga and Mazariegos have convictions for burglary and robbery.
event_breakdown:
Target Event:

The stabbing occurred around 11 p.m. April 15, 2021, at a hotel in the 11000 block of Palm Drive, according to the Desert Hot Springs Police Department.

message:
The U.S. had been pushing for leaders in the Israeli military to use GBU-39 bombs more often because they are more precise and better suited to urban environments than larger bombs.
Earlier this month, President Biden said the United States was pausing a delivery of the larger 2000-pound bombs that Israel often uses.
'The strike was conducted using two munitions with small warheads suited for this targeted strike,' Rear Adm. Daniel Hagari, the Israeli military spokesman, said.

event_breakdown:
Militants in the Hamas-controlled Gaza Strip fired a rocket into Israel for the first time in over a month on Monday, drawing retaliatory airstrikes and threats of further violence from the Israel Defense Forces.
The rocket landed in a civilian area of southern Israel, causing no injuries. The IDF responded with airstrikes on three Hamas targets in Gaza, including a military compound and a weapons manufacturing facility.
The rocket attack came just hours after the Israeli military announced that it was taking over the Rafah border crossing on the Gaza-Egypt border, a move which it said was aimed at preventing the smuggling of weapons into the Strip.

title: War in Gaza could last another seven months , Israel warns
message:
CNN —The war in Gaza will likely continue through at least the end of the year, an Israeli official warned Wednesday, seeming to dismiss the idea that fighting would end after the military offensive against Hamas in Rafah.
Israel’s national security adviser, Tzachi Hanegbi, said the year 2024 has been “defined as a year of combat” by Israel’s war cabinet.
The Israeli government had previously signaled that entering Rafah would be the final stage of its war against Hamas, which attacked Israel on October 7, killing about 1,200 people and taking some 250 people hostage.
In response, Israel launched a devastating offensive in Gaza which has killed more than 36,000 people, according to Palestinian officials.
This resilience is what has allowed this nation to survive for 75 years, and even for 3,000 years before that.
event_breakdown: Gaza

title: Pakistan : Terrorists torch girl  middle school in North Waziristan
message:
Some unidentified terrorists torched a girls'' middle school in the Razmak tehsil of North Waziristan in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province of Pakistan destroying furniture, computers and books, police said on Wednesday, Dawn reported.
Abrar, a member of Shakhimar Welfare Organisation, told Dawn the school was constructed by an organisation along with Pakistan Army''s 7th Division in 2020.
On May 9, terrorists set fire to a girls'' private school in the Shawa area of South Waziristan.
Similarly, on May 17, unidentified terrorists bombed an under-construction girls'' private school in Lower South Waziristan.
Around 500 girls were enrolled in the two schools, Government Girls Middle School Noor Jannat and Government Girls Middle School Yunus Kot which were targeted by the attackers around midnight.
event_breakdown:
Event 1: Unidentified terrorists torched a girls'' middle school in the Razmak tehsil of North Waziristan in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province of Pakistan.
Event 2: Unidentified terrorists set on fire a girls'' private school in the Shawa area of South Waziristan.
Event 3: Unidentified terrorists bombed an under-construction girls'' private school in Lower South Waziristan.

title: Israel undermines goals by harming civilians in Gaza , US tells UN - Newspaper
message:
“The continued pattern of significant civilian harm resulting from incidents like Sunday’s airstrikes undermines Israel’s strategic goals in Gaza,” deputy US Ambassador to the UN Robert Wood told the 15-member council.
An airstrike on Sunday set off a blaze in a tent camp in Rafah in southern Gaza, killing at least 45 people.
Israel — a US ally — said it had targeted Hamas militants and had not intended to harm civilians.
On Wednesday, Wood told reporters that Washington was reviewing it, but UN action was unlikely to be helpful or change the situation on the ground.
Hamas chooses to exploit the civilians of Gaza as human shields,” he told the council.

title: Dozens killed in fresh Israeli attacks on Rafah  Says Palestinian medics
message:
Gaza: Palestinian medics have said dozens of people have died in fresh Israeli attacks on the southern Gaza city of Rafah on Tuesday, two days after 45 people were reportedly killed in an airstrike which sparked international condemnation.
The Israeli military said it was investigating reports of an attack on a shelter for displaced persons in western Rafah.
Earlier on Tuesday, a spokesman for the Hamas-run health authority in Gaza said a further 18 people were killed overnight in separate Israeli attacks in Rafah.
Eyewitness reports from Rafah on Tuesday suggested the Israeli army has advanced into the city centre.

title: HYD : Two IDF Soldiers Murdered In Terror Attack Near Shechem – The Yeshiva World
message:
The IDF released for publication on Thursday morning that two IDF soldiers were killed in the ramming attack near Shechem on Wednesday evening and a third soldier was killed in battle in the northern Gaza Strip on Wednesday.
The ramming attack occurred at an IDF checkpoint near Shechem.
As IDF soldiers were checking cars, the terrorist sped to the front of the line and rammed into two soldiers.
According to a preliminary investigation, the ramming attack occurred in seconds and the soldiers had no time to respond by opening fire.
The soldier who fell in battle in northern Gaza on Wednesday was identified as Staff Sgt.

Currently, the Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 and Warzone has transitioned into Season 4. Weekly challenges have reset, meaning more Conversion Kits will roll out. The first being the JAK Harbinger Kit for the M4.

title: Sudan : How El Fasher Went From Darfur Safe Haven to All - Out War
message:
UN officials have called the situation in El Fasher "Hell on Earth" and are warning that genocide crimes may be committed.
Daily interviews that I am doing with friends and human rights monitors in El Fasher suggest that neither claim is an understatement.
The battle for El Fasher - home to as many as two million people - started last month but had long been telegraphed.
Local volunteers from the Shaqra Emergency Response Room prepare food for displaced people camped just outside of El Fasher.
The camp is on the outskirts of El Fasher and is located close to conflict front lines.
event_breakdown:
Location: El Fasher, Sudan
Date: 2022-05-25
Volunteers from the Shaqra Emergency Response Room in El Fasher are providing food for displaced people camped just outside of the city. The camp is located close to conflict front lines.

title: IDF Announces Death Of Two Soldiers In West Bank Car Ramming Attack , One In Gaza Fighting
message:
Eliya Hilel, 20 from Tel Zion, and Staff Sergeant Diego Shvisha Harsaj, 20 from Tel Aviv, were severely injured in a car-ramming attack near Shechem.
Yedidya Azugi, 20 from the settlement of Revava, fell in a battle in the north of the Gaza Strip.
The death toll in the Gaza Strip since the start of the ground offensive now stands at 287.
IDF spokespersonSergeant Yedidia Azugi, 21, from the settlement of Revava, a fighter in the 101st Battalion, Paratroopers Brigade, fell in battle in the north of the Gaza Strip.
The entire Revava settlement is in deep mourning.
event_breakdown:
Relevant events:
Car-ramming attack near Shechem: Two Israeli soldiers severely injured.
Battle in the north of the Gaza Strip: One IDF soldier fell.

title: Deaths of 3 more soldiers : 2 killed in West Bank car - ramming attack , 1 fell in battle
message:
The IDF spokesman announced on Thursday morning the deaths of three IDF soldiers.
Yedidya Azugi, 21, from Revava, of the Paratrooper Brigade’s 101st Battalion, was killed in battle in the northern Gaza Strip.
Since October 7, 642 IDF soldiers have been killed, including 291 in Gaza ground operation.
1 View gallery Staff Sgt.
Azugi, who fell in the northern Gaza Strip, lived in the West Bank settlement of Revava.
event_breakdown: IDF soldiers killed in Gaza ground operation, as number of fatalities rises to 684

title: S Korea accuses North of sending balloons with excrement across border
message:
Yonhap via REUTERS/File photoBy Jack KimSouth Korea accused North Korea on Wednesday of sending a large number of balloons across their heavily fortified border to drop objects including trash and excrement, calling the act base and dangerous.
Photographs released by the South Korean military showed inflated balloons with plastic bags tethered to them.
Balloons have regularly been sent the other way by South Korean activists, often led by North Korean defectors.
North Korea also attempted to jam GPS signals in South Korea on early Wednesday morning, although no damage was reported, the Donga Ilbo newspaper said, citing multiple unnamed government sources.
The two Koreas' large militaries face off across the military border and North Korea routinely threatens to annihilate its neighbor.
event_breakdown:
North Korea is accused of sending a large number of balloons across its heavily fortified border with South Korea to drop objects including trash and excrement. South Korea called the act base and dangerous.
North Korea also attempted to jam GPS signals in South Korea on Wednesday morning although no damage was reported, the Donga Ilbo newspaper said.

message:

“BECAUSE WE SAVED THE WORLD”It was 1943, and Andrew “Andy” Negra Jr. had just finished high school.
“There was a war going on, so I went along with everybody else.
He shows a photo of himself during his time with the Army's 128th Armored Field Artillery Battalion, 6th Armored Division.
He recalled being on the road with the 6th Armored Division, part of a push to retake the French port city of Brest, when his column was strafed by five German planes.

News Push: 1943

title: New Zealand Defence Force disposes of World War II - era mortar bomb in Whanganui
message:
Kyle Dalton said Landguard Bluff had been used for well over a century for army exercises.
Photo / Bevan ConleyKyle Dalton said Landguard Bluff had been used for well over a century for army exercises.
Photo / Bevan ConleyA three-inch drill mortar bomb found by the New Zealand Defence Force (NZDF) on Landguard Rd in Whanganui came from Word War II-era training exercises.
“The mortar was replaced by the L16 81mm mortar in the 1960s but was likely used in training until the mid-1980s.
“Three-inch mortars were used between the 1930s and 1960s, and obviously, out at Landguard Bluff, they used to hold a lot of training [sessions] there.
event_breakdown: Three-inch mortars were used between the 1930s and 1960s, and obviously, out at Landguard Bluff, they used to hold a lot of training [sessions] there.

title: At 100 , this vet says the  greatest generation  moniker fits  because we saved the world . – Winnipeg Free Press
message:
SERVICE: Army’s 128th Armored Field Artillery Battalion, 6th Armored Division.
World War II veteran Andy Negra sits in his home in Helen, Ga, on April 10, 2024.
He shows a photo of himself during his time with the Army's 128th Armored Field Artillery Battalion, 6th Armored Division.
(AP Photo/Sharon Johnson)“BECAUSE WE SAVED THE WORLD”It was 1943, and Andrew “Andy” Negra Jr. had just finished high school.
He shows a photo of himself during his time with the Army's 128th Armored Field Artillery Battalion, 6th Armored Division.
event_breakdown:
Andy Negra, 96, recalled the time he was drafted into the U.S. Army in 1944 during World War II. He was assigned to the 128th Armored Field Artillery Battalion of the 6th Armored Division. 

"I was 18 years old," said Negra, now a resident of Helen, Ga. "I didn't know what exactly war was all about."

In October 1943, Negra was among several draftees who boarded a train in New York City bound for Camp Fannin, Texas, the starting point for basic training. The 128th AFA Battalion was part of the 6th AD, a formation of mechanized infantry, tank and artillery units known for their effectiveness during World War II.

Negra's unit was equipped with 155mm self-propelled assault guns, known as "armored guns." Equipped with a .50-caliber machine gun and directed by a five-man crew, these were much like the tanks that accompanied them.

"We'd go from point A to point B, depending on where we were," Negra said during a March 31 interview at the Unicoi State Park and Lodge in Helen. "We were mainly there to support the infantry on their advances, so basically we were like assault artillery."

Part of the 6th AD, the 128th AFA Battalion was stationed near Paris and fought in the Battle of the Bulge. Negra's unit was among those ordered to relieve the 101st Airborne Division, which was surrounded in the Belgian city of Bastogne. Negra said the 6th AD headed north toward Belgium

title: Dominican Republic : The Coup That Became a War
message:
Twice before, General Wessin y Wessin, 40, had relied on his planes and tank-equipped supporting troops to settle political disputes in the Dominican Republic.
And for help this time, he called on the U.S. Said Wessin y Wessin: “We saved the country by only a hair.
Most often it was in the person of Wessin y Wessin.
In 1962, Wessin y Wessin helped stop the Armed Forces Secretary from overthrowing the seven-man civilian Council of State that administered the country after Trujillo.
He called Wessin y Wessin, who immediately agreed.
event_breakdown:
1962 Dominican Civil War
Wessin y Wessin stopped the Armed Forces Secretary from overthrowing the Dominican Republic's civilian Council of State.

title: Cleared for publication : Two soldiers murdered in attack near Shechem
message:
The IDF Spokesperson's Unit on Thursday morning cleared for publication that two soldiers were murdered in the ramming attack near Shechem (Nablus) on Wednesday evening: Staff sergeant Eliya Hilel, 20, from Tel Zion, and Staff sergeant Diego Shvisha Harsaj, 20, from Tel Aviv.
In addition, the IDF confirmed that Staff sergeant Yedidya Azugi , 21, from Revava, fell in battle in the northern Gaza Strip.
A soldier from the 101st Battalion of the Paratroopers Brigade was seriously injured in the battle in which Azugi fell.
In addition, two soldiers from the 601st Battalion were seriously injured in the battle in the southern Gaza Strip.
All the soldiers were evacuated to hospital for medical treatment and their families were notified.
event_breakdown:
IDF: 2 soldiers murdered in the ramming attack near Shechem (Nablus) Wednesday evening
IDF: Staff sergeant Yedidya Azugi, 21, from Revava, fell in battle in the northern Gaza Strip
Two soldiers from the 101st Battalion of the Paratroopers Brigade were seriously injured in the battle in which Azugi fell.
Two soldiers from the 601st Battalion were seriously injured in the battle in the southern Gaza Strip.

title: Israel says offensive in Gaza could last for seven months
message:
Israel says the corridor is awash in tunnels that have funneled weapons and other goods for Hamas — despite a yearslong blockade imposed by Israel and Egypt.
It already has complained about Israel taking over the Rafah border crossing, the only crossing between Gaza and Egypt.
An Israeli military official said Israel had notified Egypt of the takeover.
Egypt has repeatedly expressed concerns that the Israeli offensive could push Palestinians across the border — a scenario Egypt says is unacceptable.
The Israeli military official said Israel has also taken “tactical control” of Tel al-Sultan, a neighborhood on Rafah’s northwest edge.
event_breakdown: Israel has taken over the Rafah border crossing, the only crossing between Gaza and Egypt, as well as Tel al-Sultan, a neighborhood on Rafah's northwest edge.
